title: Help us beta test our USA Open Data Certificates

details.description: We are delighted to announce the public beta of Open Data Certificates for the USA and we need your help.
details.excerpt: We are delighted to announce the public beta of [Open Data Certificates](https://certificates.theodi.org/) for the USA and we need your help.
details.content:
We are delighted to announce the public beta of Open Data Certificates for the USA and we need your help.

Open Data Certificates are designed to help you make open data more accessible and useful to its users. They give a set of practical recommendations for open data publishers so that they can make an informed choice about what and how to publish and support their open data.

What is an Open Data Certificate?

A certificate measures the quality of your open data. Unlike other standards, it goes beyond just the technical aspects of open data to look holistically at your open data “as-a-service”.

There are four levels against which you can measure your dataset. By going through a simple questionnaire process, you will get:

  • A set of practical guides on how you can improve your quality of your open data
  • A certificate for your open data, which also doubles up as a quick reference sheet for your dataset for the re-users
  • An embeddable badge to showcase your Open Data Certificate, acting as a recognisable quality mark

How can you help?

Led by the ODI North Carolina Node, we have been busy localising the certificate so that it reflects and incorporates the specific regulatory and legal requirements in the US jurisdiction.

We now need you to participate by assessing your open data using our localised Open Data Certificates. This will help us with quality assurance before the US certification goes live.

How to start the questionnaire

Simply follow the steps below to access the localised version of the questionnaire:

  1. Open the questionnaire by going to ‘Create new certificate’
  2. Click the pencil icon near the the left hand corner
  3. From the drop-down menu, select ‘United States’
  4. Click ‘Change jurisdiction’
  5. The questionnaire should be switched to the US version and it should display its Jurisdiction as US at the top left hand corner

How do I feedback?

Please report any bugs or mistakes, or post general comments about Open Data Certificates using:

GitHub by raising a new issue; or Open Data Certificates user feedback form

Our aim is to deliver a final version of the USA version of Open Data Certificates in June. Please provide your feedback by Friday, 15 June 2015.
